content.detailedDescription: While seated on the south side in the arvest ballpark stadium on the 4th of july, 2010, my family and i observed three lights together, coming from the south (the direction of fayetteville) toward the north, clothed in flaming red and appearing to be on fire.  as it continued on a steady path toward the north, it seemingly continued through the fireworks display at the ballpark.  the object was moving slowly, as if observing the whole fireworks display, and after coming through the area disappeared to my vision.  though it began as individual lights, it appeared after about 10 minutes to glow flaming red.  it seemed to be cylindrical in shape, and continued its journey northward until i could see it no more.  i jokingly said to my granddaughter, i hope the pilot of that thing didn't catch on fire, going through all those fireworks!  at first sighting of the object, i told my family to look at the ufo.  they laughed at me, as usual.
content.summary: Ufo sighted over fayetteville/springdale, arkansas area on 4th of july.

content.detailedDescription: I, my sister, and my two sons saw something over tyler, tx around 9:25 pm on july 10, 2010. the sky was not completely dark yet. my sons and i were in the pool. i put my head back to dip my hair into the water... when i saw a bright red glow approaching from the distance. one of my sons saw it at the same time, and we both said "what is that?"  it was traveling at the speed of a plane, and as it approached.. my younger son and i saw something behind the glow... almost like a parachute shape, but translucent looking. my son said it looked like  a glare on something behind the light. but then that shape went away, and all we saw was a red fireball. by this point, it looked like a plane on fire. my older son called for my sister to come outside.  we stood in shock.. it looked like a plane in flight that was in flames. we could see the burning flicker of flames. we were scared because we thought it was a plane on fire and we were just waiting for it to fall... and my mind was thinking, "how can a plane still fly if it's on fire?"... but it continued on in the distance until it could no longer be seen. once it was gone, we realized that it could not have been a plane because there was no noise. it was completely silent. once the reality hit that we had not seen a plane on fire, we knew it was a ufo... and i wished i'd looked at it as one from the beginning. there were no other reports of this to the local news station when my sister called, and no one else i know saw it. people keep saying it was a weather balloon or hot air balloon that we must have seen. yeah right. i've seen both, and this was neither. a hot air balloon has no forward propulsion, and it was so close that we would have seen the balloon. two things we noted... 1. it followed the same path that planes had flown from over us earlier. 2. we noticed what looked like the remains of a thick jet stream breaking apart over us shortly afterward. we did not get a good picture, because my son did not find the phone in time. by the time he got it, the object was in the distance... just before it disappeared from  sight. when i enlarge the photo it is too distorted. the sky was darker by then, and it looks pixelated. there is only a red dot.
content.summary: Red-orange fireball over tyler, texas.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
After parking my car my friend matt and i were heading back to the upper dorms at oit. we were previously admiring the planet venus as the sun set over the horizon but as we turned around a very noticeably bright white/pale blue object could be see "hanging" in the air. it slowly started moving east in an almost(lazy) serpentine fashion and eventually flew over some hills behind the dorms.

my friend said it looked very large (and with two light sources from each tip) from his perspective, and that it looked as if it were two smaller objects that merged into one, but all i could make out was an extremely bright orb. 
(no photos though :( a cell phone cam wouldn't do justice)
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Walking back from my car a friend and i noticed a very luminous orb making its way over oit.

content.detailedDescription:
I have compiled a few videos of still shots taken from my front yard. the ones submitted are very recent, although i have been taking pictures of them since january 2009. they are in the sky every night without fail and one doesn't have to wait and see if they appear. the reason i have still shots and not video clips is that my camera presents them more clearly in the picture mode. all were taken with an olympus c-2100 ultra zoom. 2.1 mega pixel w/10x optical zoom. not very up to date equipment for sure.

i could write a book on just what these "things" can do. they can change shapes and sizes, move at lightening speeds or hover. make noises like aircraft and the list goes on. 
i would like more info on just who or what may contact me before i can agree to release my info to a third part. mufon may use any and all of the videos i presented as it deems it needs to. mufon  may copy and distribute as its deems it needs to.

it is important to note that they are there nightly. 

thanks for your time concerning this matter.
content.shape: Fireball,   Flash,   Oval,   Sphere,   Square,   Rectagular,   Star-like
content.summary: Nightly ongoing recurrences of events. i have been taking photos since january 2009.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home with my wife & son after a birthday party and was driving  west on i-90.  we were slowing to a stop near road constructon near elgin when i noticed the lights (six in a line to the west) in the sky to our left (south) and pointed them out to my wife.  at first i thought it was just planes in a landing pattern going to o'hare until we noticed that they were solid orange, flickered like fire and had no other noticable lights.  at this point my heart was racing and i had my wife (she was visibly worried)call my father (who is usually in bed listening to news radio at this time) to see if he heard anything about this. (i grew up near o'hare intl. airport and have worked next to it for the past 14 years and am familiar with seeing the sky filled with approaching planes with their landing lights etc... and these were not the same.)  my next thought was that maybe these lights were a type of flare, but they were steadily moving east and did not appear to be decending.   after a couple of minutes we slowly started moving with traffic again as the last object moved past and behind us where i lost sight of it as it went over some light clouds.  i have attached a sketch that i made in photoshop.
content.summary: Orange flickering flame.

content.detailedDescription: While vacationing at eden lake, my wife and i with our three boys were on the west shore of the lake watching people practice their fireworks (for july 4th the next night) all around the edge of the lake. around the peak of the fireworks, my wife first noticed this strange light. it was a stationary and very bright red ball of light. it appeared to be at least 10 times larger than venus would look from our vantage, and was hovering probably 100-200 feet above the eastern side of the lake. it was not blinking, but more like pulsating, continually changing its intensity between a dull red and a very bright red which also made it look bigger. after 2-3 minutes, it simply faded in intensity and disappeared completely without moving off in any direction. a couple of minutes later a second light appeared above the north end of the lake and behaved and disappeared in the exact manner, only the latter was more of an amber/orange rather than pure red. they were definately not part of the fireworks, more like they were just checking it out. of course, they did not show up the next night for the larger display when i brought my camera.
content.summary: Two orbs checking out fireworks.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing in my driveway,between my house and my neighbors house trying to quiet their barking dog.I looked up into the sky and noticed some strange movement.Luckily i had my glasses on because with out them,i'm sure i wouldn't have noticed them because of the fuzzy,translucence nature of them.I had to really look hard and focus,to try to make out what i was looking at.My first thought was that i was looking at a formation of high flying fighter jets heading due east.There were either 5 or 7 soft,glowing,translucent,orange triangles that made no sound whatsoever.Then just as i realized that this is something strange,they either disappeared,or flew out of my sight.It all happened so fast,i can't say for sure.I can't say for sure whether i was looking at numerous triangled shaped objects in a triangle formation, or one triangled shaped object with triangled shaped lights at its edges.The movement of them was very strange!The best way that i can describe their movement,was that they looked like something gliding underwater,just near the surface,when what you're looking at looks somewhat distorted because of the movement of the water.After,i was quite excited about what i saw.I watch the sky many nights,and i know i've never seen anything like this.
content.summary: Dull orange, translucent triangles. 5or 7 of them. no sound. heading due east. speed unknown.

content.detailedDescription: i was lying outside with my wife on a blanket.  it was a sunny sunday afternoon with few clouds. i think the time was around 4:00 pm. i star gaze at night sometimes with my binoculars or my telescope.  i just thought i would lay out and look up in the daytime with my binoculars because i know at night i can see far more stars with them.  while looking i saw what at first glance looked like the moon. (what i am describing in terms of my thoughts happened in split seconds) i then realized it couldn't be the moon because i hadn't seen it with the naked eye and it was too small through the binoculars. i believe the moon was not in an observable phase at that time, though i am not sure. it can be best described as having the appearance of a light bulb unlit. the bottom right hand corner of the sphere seemed to be darker. through the binoculars, its size was about the size of a pea held out at arms length.(that's why i thought i was looking at the moon at first). it did not move when the binoculars moved so i deduced it was not a spot on the lense.  i commented to my wife that i was seeing something different when it suddenly flattened, brightened, and 'shot' to the north.  it wasn't moving when i first saw it.  i lost sight of it as it went behind trees and never saw it again.  i am my own harshest cynic.  i have seen things before but was always able to explain them.  this i cannot.  i am a minister and i do not drink. i live in sw pennstylvania east of pittsburgh. the experience has left me very curious.
content.summary: Saw a round object similar to the moon through binoculars in the afternoon in a blue sky. object then flattened and quickly went north and out of site.

content.detailedDescription:
At 2am, i was trying to make contact with a spacecraft.  i went to a zen state of mind, and be one with the universe.

a very bright yellow star appeared in the sky.... and moved east to west... west to east.

at 4h30am the star was still in the sky and then disappeared.

i felt peacefull, happy and i believed that together we can move a better world....
content.summary: Bright yellow star.

content.detailedDescription:
It was the early morning hours, and i awoke facing my wall that i slept next to with a strange premonition/feeling. a feeling i was getting urged me to roll over. so i rolled over, and visible was a thick, white beam, about as wide as a gallon-bucket of paint, piercing through my bedroom wall from the outside of the house in the opposite side of my room. from there, the beam pointed at an angle to about the center of my floor, and pierced down through. a faint, almost electrical hum was audible, as well as a hazy, light smoke that was only visible in the path of the beam. this beam was very dense and bright itself, but it only slightly lit the rest of the room. 

i felt rather nervous and worried (but oddly enough fairly calm), not knowing what i was seeing. but rather than get up to check things out, i automatically rolled over and pulled the covers over my head. from there i'm not sure if i actually fell back asleep right away, or what. i usually have trouble sleeping, especially if something has made me alert, but i don't remember anything else until the next morning.

i walked downstairs into the kitchen where my roommate, who had the bedroom located directly below mine, was. i mentioned to her that i saw something strange in the early hours of that morning, and that's when she asked me if i was refering to the light. i was glad to find out that i was not the only one who saw it, and she began to describe what she saw. 

she told me she saw a beam of light coming through the center of her ceiling and it came down at an angle to the opposite corner of the room from which the beam entered my room. in addition to the beam, she said there was an incredible bright light shining through her window. she says she got up and closed her blinds to make it go away, and then she went back to bed.

the fact that she saw the same beam i did, pointing in the same direction at the same location, shining through my floor and coming out of that point in her ceiling, really makes me wonder to this day, if there was just that beam, or something more. my blinds were closed and i had a blanket hung up to block out most light, so i did not observe anything bright coming through my window.

as well, i am alarmed at how calm i was facing a scenario that would scare the daylight out of me if i saw it right this moment, which makes me curious as to whether i fell back asleep at all, or whether through my own will or others' intervention, i don't want to remember...
content.summary: Intense beam of light, low humming noise, fog visible in beam.

content.detailedDescription:
1. since 3 nights ago when drinking with family, objects that resemble normal stars have moved from east to west with great speed in zig-zag patterns that do not resemble those of orbital satellites. tonight and the previous night (july 11th), i was compelled to observe, un-intoxicated, to validate what i saw and dismiss the objects which i had seen. astonished, i observed several star-like objects move in ways that are unexplainable these past few days all of them moving erratically but moving east to west generally.

2. i first noticed these objects when i was staring at the sky and noticed movement.

3. i first thought the object was a satellite or perhaps even the iss but then the object began moving in a fashion unlike anything i have ever seen.

4. (12th) after star-gazing, when movement was first detected, the star like object was moving steadily from east to west but darted to the left of my field of vision and then to the center several times before disappearing well before reaching my observable horizon.

5. feelings - confusion and amazement.

6. object disappeared - did not move over the visible horizon although might be attributed to light pollution.
content.summary: Object that resembled a star moving in erratic zig-zags but moving from east to west.

content.detailedDescription:
I was taking photos one afternoon of some beautiful thunderclouds that were building. i took aprx 12 photos. when i downloaded them i found a strange object in two different photos. i did not see them when i took the photos.
one is in the top center of the photo and appears as maybe something flat and dark. the other one is also dark but the end of it looks different. it appears to be going into the cloudbank on the left. i was zoomed in on these clouds as far as my zoom goes, i think 10x.
i don't know what they are but maybe you can figure it out, i hope so.
i am also sending a photo i took about 6 years ago. i was taking pictures of my horses in the pasture and i did not see anything in my camera lens at the time i took the photos. i don't know if you are intersted in something that long ago but it i think it might be worth it. it looks like some kind of vapor trail or something trailing the object.
thank you for your time and i hope we get some answers.
[cms/tg/pid]
content.summary: Ufos showed up in two of my photos.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside in my backyard watching for meteors when i noticed a large anomaly moving from east to west at a very high altitude. the object had a translucent faint orange/gold semi v-shaped leading edge and was shaped similar to a flying wing type aircraft only much, much larger with a transparent look to it. the object moved in a straight line from roughly east to west, making no sound, and traversed the entire visible sky in less than 30 seconds. i am very familiar with all types of conventional aircraft having been a plane enthusiast for over 30 years, and this object fit no description of anything i have ever seen. it had no marker lights and was much too large and fast to be any ordinary aircraft. its absolutely straight course, translucent appearance and color, and its shape and immense size would discount the possibility of it being a searchlight, reflection, or other easily explainable source.
content.summary: Translucent orange/gold v-shaped object flying from east to west.

content.detailedDescription:
I saw two ufo's in the space of a few hours. the first i saw from my window looking west towards nyc, i saw a bright light moving west towards manhattan. it was moving slowly and was like a bright star, looked at it through binoculars and it looked like a star, there were no flashing or red lights on it, saw it for about 20 sec's then i lost view due to a tree outside my window. i always see plains going by my window and the never fly in the direction it was going, also there were two other plains flying at the same time, you could see the red flashing lights on them. that was at 21.44pm on july 11th.

the second was at 1.43am on the 12th july. was outside having a smoke looking at a clear sky, was out for about a minute and saw a bright light fly through the sky at low altitude towards jersey city heights. it was to low to be a shooting star and looked like a missile fly trough the sky, only lasted a second. got goose bumps when i saw it.Was no sound from it and reminded me of a meteorite but was way to low. going back out to see if i can see anything else and i will keep you updated.

thanks
content.summary: Saw two in the space of a few hours.

content.detailedDescription: Fter it passed us it continued on untill it passed the nexted bonn fire about 300 yards away and then it went out. the party at the other fire immeadiately left the beach. w gathered our things and put out our fire and left shortley there after.The park ranger met uus at the stairs and questioned us all as to what we saw. the next day we called the park rangers office to find out what it was.They had no information except a note saying they were called to check out a spectical. if you know of anything about this please let us know. thank you,
content.summary: An object that looked  like a plane at first.Came toward us as we were sitting around a fire on maconi park beach, north eastham cape cod. the object emitted a weird green light on us that was shimmery and seemed like a bar code.

content.detailedDescription: my friends and i were sitting outside when i saw something out of the corner of my eye. we all looked up and saw a ball of light moving slowly north. it disappeared after about 10 seconds. 2 minutes later it appeared again in the same spot and continued moving north and then disappeared again after about 5 seconds.
content.summary: Ball of light.

content.detailedDescription:
Me and my friend were sitting on my front poarch talking and in the western sky a bright white light appeared  and faded as it moved northward.
we thought that  was strange ,but not within normal bounds...
about 10 minutes later another one appered same part of sky ,same direction, but slightly dimmer...
we tried to reason out the  lights you know? militery flares, lighting,aircraft, satellite,  weather , lasers, metorites,  ect...

we could not find any resonable explaination....!!!

a few minutes later my friend was standing in the yard and spotted another light in the northeastern sky.  his detription  was a more of a orange glow , but with the same pattern..

facts;
1. lights appeared in western sky..
2. faded as it moved north.
3. moved in a strait line.
4. 3 sighting in the same night by two people..
5. no sounds.
6. no electrial outage..


conclusion -  can not explain! maybe someone out there has seen these lights..

good sky watching
content.summary: Bright light with star quality.

content.detailedDescription: I went out into my backyard at around 18:00 hours today, 7/11/2010 to smoke a cigarette.  it was a beautiful clear warm day with around 10 knot wind blowing from the north with no visible clouds.  i first started seeing this unknown white circle craft(s)last summer.  the frequency of sighting increased towards late summer/fall, almost every weekend, but not much in the winter due poor weather.  the craft usually hovers and starts to move very very slowly through the skies, some seen at different altitudes (10,000-15,000 feet).  they sometimes travel horizontally and sometime vertically until i can no longer see them.  my wife and i have once witnessed 3 crafts of different color, 2 traveling in different directions and 1 craft just hovering with very little movement.  today i decided to sit in a shaded area with open view of the sky to enjoy my cigarette.  as i was enjoying my cigarette, i decide to look up to see if i might have a chance of seeing this unusual crafts and got a shock of my life.  instead of seeing my usual single craft, i saw a fleet of 27-30 white circular crafts traveling in northerly direction very slowly in an elongated formation with no pattern, some in close formation and others far apart.  after recovering from the shock of seeing so many crafts, i ran into the house to get my wife to witness what i had just saw.  i told her to sit next to me and look up and see if she was seeing the multiple circle objects that seems to be hovering 11,000-15,000 feet in the sky which she confirmed she was seeing.  i see many different types of known aircrafts due to our home being close proximity to oakland and san francisco airport, but these crafts were circular with no visible fuselage or wings like normal aircrafts.  we heard no usual noise that is made either by a piston or jet engine and we ruled out balloons because they were traveling north where the wind was blowing from. it took about 15 minutes for these crafts to travel out of our sight.
content.summary: Fleet of ufos seen over san francisco/bay area.

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking back from the store & turned from the main street to the smaller one , ay that time there was nothing in the sky , & as i've turned the corner there on the lawn of the property at about 1 step from me was a a round flat toy & on it it was printed"flying disc" , & i kind a laughed  out loud thinking ' ah , a sign i'll see them now" ? i looked up , nothing 10 steps forward & there it was high to the left blinking pure white light than blink off & so on , obviously in a gliding motion from s to n line , needless to say i thought "thanks guys & the humor too" , i thought it was cute . i was in a steady slowed pace & didn't stop this time . than the darkened tree branch & its foillege got in to my view obscuring the flushing lights . as i quickened past the tree i saw it last time blink than dark & than i couldn't see it anymore as i turned again & the large condo blocked it . when i got to the lightened area (security lights) i checked my watch & it was 11:05 plus some seconds . i did made sure if i'd still see it in the distance somewhere later but no .
at home i was by the window 10-15 min later & saw a plane going same direction more or less but that one was human made .
content.summary: Humorous sighting tonight.

content.detailedDescription: it was between 2 and 3 am. my husband was recovering from knee replacement surgery and was sleeping in another bedroom across from mine. his bedroom window was facing north. when i went into the room to check on him  i could see through the window a very bright white light moving in the sky towards the house. i could not hear any noise. as the object approched and was about to go over the house i went back to my own bedroom window (faces south) to see what this thing was. it went almost directly over the house. i opened my bedroom window to listen, it was completely silent as it passed. the object was large and low and seem to slowly float over . the back of the craft appeared rounded with multi- colored non-blinking lights. it was very large; as large as a football field.  my immediate thoughts was that this must be a u.F.O. the object just slowly floated away over the tree line of the neighboring park.
content.summary: Large, silent ship floating very low over the house.

content.detailedDescription: I went outside for a cigarette and was walking back and forth along the sidewalk when i seen this object come out from above tree top level across the street from behind a tree.  i can only guess it was the same or same type of object as reported before because i could not see any detail of the object itself except for the flame coming out from the bottom.  the darkness of the night sky prevented me from seeing the object itself.  it was traveling from the southwest to the northeast direction.  i viewed this object for approximately 3 or 4 minutes before i could no longer see it across the railroad tracks and an open field.  when i came back upstairs i noticed it was 9:45 p.M.  its rate of speed appeared to be about 5 m.P.H.
content.summary: Sphere emitting flame seen again.

content.detailedDescription:
Three round orange lights came thru the sky as high as a plane (to high to be a fire work)...They went slow and then just turned and faded ..The lights were much bigger than shown in the picture , we all could not figure out what they were .Perfectly round balls of orange ... 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

(the below is not for publishing just for your info)
note: this is a cut and paste of an email i received. person wishes to remain anon. they sent pics but i'm to puter stupid to know how to save them and add them here but will fwd email with pics, minus senders info, to you if you wish. also i really don't know what county they're in? catawba sounds familiar. thank you, *wit's name deleted--sgonzalez/cms.
content.summary: Orange lights in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: This is the 6th time i have seen this northwest of my house over the water.  it was colorful, round in shape, silent and moved closer to me for a brief moment, then backed away.  it turned on its side several times and looked more saucer shaped, then back to hover in its original state which was round.  my daughter in law and son took video clips of it.  in the video you can see that it was moving around.  at one time when it came in closer, it disappeared and at the same time, the battery on my still camera and my son's video camera went dead.  after about 60 seconds, it reappeared, and both of our cameras began working again.
content.summary: Observed large pulsating colorful hovering object for two consecutive nights that moved toward me and then backed away. through the binoculars it appeared transparent with multi-colored lights. it disappeared quicky,

content.detailedDescription: I was up at mueller state park at 9:25 p.M. the night of the 10th. the sky was reasonably clear to the east with dark clouds to the west. i was standing facing north talking to someone when i looked up at the northeastern sky and saw a large, bright, fast moving object. it was perfectly round, a little bigger than the size of venus, but it did not "sparkle" or "twinkle." it was moving very fast and make a quick, wobbling movement to the right before correcting itself and disappearing behind a very small cloud. i expected it to come out from behind the cloud, but it did not. it's just like it stopped behind it or fazed out. someone mentioned that the iss was going to fly by and i thought that maybe that's what i saw, but then the iss flew by about an hour later. it was moving a lot slower that the object i saw and was a different color. the iss was orange or amber and the object i saw was white, possibly slightly pink. also, the iss moved in a straight line, while the object i saw jerked very suddenly to the right. i don't know of meteors doing this movement and it was odd that it did not reappear behind the cloud. unfortunately, due to the speed of the object, i only saw it for about 3 seconds, but it was long enough to ascertain color, shape, speed and movement.
content.summary: Bright object changes direction, disappears behind small cloud and does not reappear

content.detailedDescription:
Date & time is an estimation; event was 18 years ago

at age nine (9) years old, i was arriving home late one spring night with my mother and two older siblings when i noticed unusual bright stars out of the corner of my eye. i turned to see what was so unusual about these stars. as we drove closer, i realized between these stars, i couldn't see other stars. i felt a bit frightened, but definitely more curious.

the ufo hovered just over the top of the pine trees at the southwest corner of the property. the top of trees was only roughly 20~25 and from where it was hovering, it would not be visible from the house as there would've been trees blocking the view.

the ufo was triangle in shape with lights in three corners, which seems to be a normal sighting. i'm assuming it made no noise, i was in a moving vehicle when i saw it. it appeared black in color but it was quite dark that night; no moon light. the size of the object was roughly 70~90 ft in length.

when i was within 700~800 ft from the ufo, still in the vehicle, it slowly started to drift towards to south west for a few seconds before rapidly accelerating in the same direction at a speed where it was out of site within seconds.

my older siblings were in the back of vehicle asleep and my mother didn't see anything as she was driving. my father was in the house during this time. once we were parked in the driveway, i got out of the vehicle as though nothing had happened. i walked to where the ufo had been hovering and looked out across the field in the direction it had gone.

to this day, i still question if i saw anything at all. what it my imagination in conjunction with being tired causing me to have dreams while being awake? was there anything there at all? was i hallucinating? was it actually stars i was seeing?

i always feel as though i did actually see something. i second guess myself to this day even as i second guessed myself at the moment i realized i thought i was seeing ufo. i never believed in ufo before then. from then on, i started to wonder profusely.

i have never spoken of this to my family. i seldom speak of this to anyone unless they tell me they've seen something like it. i don't want people to think i'm 'crazy'. on the rare occasion when i do speak of the event. i am overcome by terrible goose-bumps and teary eyes. i have never seen anything like it since.

though i have never seen anything like it since, there have been several times where things have occurred where i thought my farm might have been visited again by something i might not have ever seen. i always thought my mind was just getting the best of me out of fear or curiosity regarding the post events.
content.summary: Saw ufo stationary over corner of farm stead.

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing with a friend on the hill which is a part of st aidens church in rochdale when we noticed a craft crossing the pennines from the north and travelled due south, the speed of the craft was tremendous.
its flight path was sporadic as it initially flew north to south and then stopped dead in its tracks, from memory i think it then shot towards a s westerly direction, stopped and the navigated to the east, stopped one last time and then disapeared towards the n east.
a couple of minutes later three or four black helicopters crossed over the pennines from the original direction of the craft.
the craft was black and circular shaped.
i was wondering if anybody else remembers this occurence? please bear in mind that i may be out with the year.
content.summary: Ufo followed by helicopters across the pennines uk.

content.detailedDescription:
On the evening of july 9,2010, i was sitting in my garden and resting.
this was about 8:20 in the evening. i looked to the west and noticed a hovering red light that i thought was helicopter leaving the area. we
have helicopters leaving from ball hospital in muncie, indiana near here and they fly over our house from time to time, coming and going.I didn't think much about this light until i looked over to the same spot and
it had yet to leave. i looked to see if it was moving, either towards us, or away. i realized that it appeared to be stationary,noted that it was reddish/orange and was hovering. i called my husband in his shop to come out to see this light . we got our binoculars out and tried to focus on the object. it was hard to keep a focus on it as it was vibrating/oscillating. it was in the air over chesterfield ,indiana for about 25 minutes total. it had gone a little more west, faded, then came back, hovered and while my husband was out in the road looking at it, it
basically disapppeared.
 i didn't have any particular feelings when i saw this. just being inquisitive about why a light would be in the area and stationary for such a long time. this is the first time we have seen anything like this in our area.
content.summary: I noted that a light of undetermined shape, red in color stayed in sky for about 25 minutes over chesterfield, in.

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing in my back yard smoking a cigarette as my visiting parents were going to sleep and wife was putting the dog in the laundry room for bed.  i saw a bright orange sphere that somewhat resembled a glowing hot air balloon or 'clouded flame' moving from the east.  it was too bright to be a plane headlight and there were no blinking lights as a plane would have.  as it approached it peaked my interest as it seemed too low for an airplane and i knew if it was i should hear something.  not wanting to take my eyes off it i tried calling my wife with my cell phone to see if she had her phone nearby at 10:31 pm ct to have her come look.  i then turned on my phones camera and took a picture at 10:33 pm ct.  i watched it pass, and as it was moving away to the west with a very slight (barely noticeable) southern curve there was more of a faint bluish glow on the back side, not bright light like the front, and i could see somewhat of a counter-clockwise vertical rotation.  i snapped 2 more pictures at 10:34 pm ct in the general direction with my phone, i couldn't see the object but could pinpoint the area based on the lights on the ground.  before it moved off i ran inside to see if the wife was busy to come look, but took too long and it was gone by the time we went back out.

at 11:04 pm ct i was in the driveway making sure the cars were locked and smoking one more cigarette before bed.  straight up i saw 2 small very distant white lights following almost in tow of each other moving south to north.  i would have written it off as a satellite if there was only one but being 2 i was unsure.  once again i snapped another picture in the general direction but haven't reviewed that photo yet.

today my wife was curious and 'googling' what i told her and made me want to fill this out.

the first picture i added is the front view.  the 2nd was trying to capture the rear view.  the 3rd image i added a circle around the general area i think i remember it being.  hopefully you have some better photo software and can see more than i can.
content.summary: Silent orange sphere, only lit on 'front' side, seemed to rotate vertically from the rear view.

content.detailedDescription:
I wes sitting on my deck drinking coffee. i noticed a bright object in the nw sky about 60 degrees above the horizon. it was still and appeared to brighten periodically. i observed it for several minutes as it stood still. it started slowly  moving toward the se. i followed the object using 8x32 binoculars. it appeared to be boomerang shaped, thicker in the middle back side, and was at very high altitude. i would estimate the altitude at >100,000 feet. my altitude estimate is based on the amount of binocular focus adjustment that i had to make to get the object into focus, above that normally required to focus on cross country commercial jets traveling at 35,000 feet. i would estimate its size as equal to or greater than a commercial airliner.

when i had the object in focus, it appeared that it slowly rotated about once every 5-10 seconds, as it moved forward. it reflected the sunlight more or less brightly as it rotated. the surface was metalic and white to orange in the color reflected. as it progressed toward the more intense sunlight of the se and nearby trees, i lost contact.
content.summary: "boomerang" sighting centennial, colorado.

content.detailedDescription:
This is my third report, so much is happening that it is hard to remember everything.
lastnight i awoke a little after midnight and as usual looked out my window to see what is going on with all these crazy lights in our little valley and on the hill in front of my house was an electrical looking tower where there isn't supposed to be one, it was pulsating very bright white lights. i watched it for awhile but since i am experiencing these strange lights nightly for months, i soon went back to bed.
the usual lights i have previously described were there as well. but in my last report i forgot to mention that when i have been out of town i have experienced the same usual lights...I have seen them in stockton, cobb mtn and up in fortuna, ca...The large one hovering in the night sky that looks like a large star, the large ones that are either golden, white, or light blue that look like crosses and also look like their reflecting off windows. sometimes they are but on a recent visit to my sister's i found out differently.
i took the dog out @ 1am and noticed the large golden cross looking lights that looked like they were reflecting off windows in the church across the street. i hadn;'t been there in a while so i thought the church had built additions. when i went out in the morning where i had seen the 'reflecting' lights it was just open field! there were 8 of them.
i also forgot to mention these stationary lights that are white and look like a bug or something. there are always about a dozen of them in the night sky, in every town i have visited lately. you can tell they are not stars, they are not satelites as they are just a few hundred feet from the rooftops. they are here everynight and i feel they are just watching...
well, i certainly hope somebody else here in hidden valley lake will come forward and share their experiences.
until next time...
content.summary: There was another electrical looking tower where there isn't supposed to be one that was pulsating very bright lights on the hill in front of my house.
